snippet: Brian Mulligan, the Deutsche Bank executive claiming to have been beaten by Los Angeles police officers during an altercation in May, told a Glendale police officer that he had used so-called bath salts stimulants, according to a recording of the...
abstract: Brian Mulligan, the Deutsche Bank executive claiming to have been beaten by Los Angeles police officers during an altercation in May, told a Glendale police officer that he had used so-called bath salts stimulants, according to a recording of the conversation.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

lead_paragraph: Brian Mulligan, the Deutsche Bank executive claiming to have been beaten by Los Angeles police officers during an altercation in May, told a Glendale police officer that he had used so-called bath salts stimulants, according to Bloomberg News. A tape of the conversation, which took place two days before the violent incident, was released by the Los Angeles Police Protective League. Read more »

headline.main: L.A. Banker Spoke of Using ‘Bath Salts’ Before Police Trouble
